    • Course

      public Course()
      Default constructor

    • Course

      public Course(String name, int credit) throws InvalidName
      Parameterized Constructor with all attributes provided as arguments. The `public Course (String name , int credit)` constructor is a parameterized constructor for the `Course` class. It takes two arguments, `name` and `credit`, which are used to initialize the `name` and `credits` variables of the `Course` object.
      Parameters:
      name - [String] : Name of the course
      credit - [int] : credit of course
      Throws:
      InvalidName

    • Course

      public Course(Course other)
      Copy Constructor It takes another `Course` object `other` as an argument and creates a new `Course` object with the same `name` and `credits` values as the `other` object.
      Parameters:
      other - [Course] Another course to be copied

    • setName

      public void setName(String name) throws InvalidName
      The function sets the name of a course, but throws an exception if the name is null or invalid.
      Parameters:
      name - The name parameter is a String that represents the name of the course.
      Throws:
      InvalidName

    • setCredit

      public void setCredit(int credit)
      The function sets the credit length of a course, but if the input is 0 or negative, it prints an error message and does not set the credit length.
      Parameters:
      credit - The parameter "credit" is an integer that represents the length or number of credits for a course.

    • getName

      The function returns the name of an object.

    • getCredit

      public int getCredit()
      The function returns the value of the "credits" variable.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the value of the variable "credits".

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString: The toString() function returns a string representation of a course object, including the name and number of credits.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      If the name and credits variables have values, the method will return a string in the format "name, a credits unit course." If either name or credits is null or 0, the method will return an empty string.
